column3: Hereinafter, no terbri will have any default specification unless explicitly given one in the discourse or unless the "official" definition default value is referenced explicitly by the appropriate pro-sumti. See also: {dai'o}, {zmico}, {gafyzmico}, {da'o}.

column2: pro-sumti whose referent's identity may be chosen by the listener
column3: Short for "lo poi'i do zifre lo ka jdice lo du'u ma kau me ke'a"; e.g. "ko ciksi bau do'au" (explain in any language you like!), "mi ba klama fo do'au" (I'll go, and you're free to choose what route I'll go by), "do'au sivni do" (you're free to keep whatever you want private to yourself). The chosen identity may be plural; the last example shows this is useful. See {nau'o}. Also kind of like {ma}, but instead of "please fill this hole with a truthful thing for my sake (and tell me it)", it's "please fill this hole with a preferred thing for your sake (and act on it)".

column2: impersonal pronoun; generic-you; generic-one; a generalized person
audience switch marker.
column3: Indicates that the addressee has changed (even if no-one has ever been explicitly specified to have been an audience member); it does not specify who the new addressee is.

column2: location tense relation/direction (angular); clockwise from..., locally rightwards/to the right of ...
$x_1$ is June in year $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$
discursive: \n{do'a } - generously\n{do'a nai} - parsimoniously.
gafyzmico: Reset all default specification of the immediately previous word to their respective discourse-external/official definition specifications for this instance/usage only.
column3: Resets all defaults (default specifications) in the (terbri) structure of immediately previously uttered word so that implicit/omitted {zo'e} and {di'au} that may fill the terbri of that word are predefined/specific in reference and do indeed necessarily agree with the default setting explicitly specified in the discourse-exterior/official definition of the word. The terbri are not filled by this word. Usage is only meaningful for a brivla with at least one terbri (regardless of being explicitly filled or otherwise). In a tanru or other complicated construct, only the most recent word undergoes this terbri default restoration (not every term in the construct). A selbri converted to a sumti by gadri has the x1 terbri filled for the purposes of this word, but the default setting of that terbri is so restored all the same; likewise is the case for terbri accessed by {be} or {bei}; seltau in the main level of a sumti are filled by the gadri as well for the purposes of this word. The restoration is only effective for the single occurrence/instant/usage of this word (the next use of the affected word will be implicitly accompanied by its terbri defaults, as defined elsewhere (by official definition or by other (permanent) modifications made to the word)). See also: {dau'a}, {de'oi}, {zmico}
column5: default reset (across all associated terbri);default restoration (across all associated terbri)

column2: generic vocative address to intended listener;.
anti-vocative: specifically denies that the referent is the intended listener.
column3: *Note: Only accepted by experimental grammar* (u'u doinai la .djon.) = "Sorry, I wasn't talking to you, John". May also be used alone if the referent is obvious from context.

column2: Quotes a word; the result is a pro-sumti for the most recent utterance containing that word.
column3: A useful alternative to {di'u} {de'u} etc. that doesn't make you count utterances.

column2: generic single-word generic vocative marker; identifies intended listener with a single, possibly non-Lojban word, delimited by pauses (in speech) or by whitespace (in writing).
column3: The intent is that it is allowed everywhere in the grammar where DOI and COI are. See also {zo'oi}, {la'oi}, {me'oi}, {ra'oi}. Not similar to {co'oi}. Equivalent to {doi} {la'oi}.

column2: pro-sumti: the original speaker (= you the primary listener/target) and the rest of the audience, excluding the new/current speaker (= me).
column3: Used in reply to someone who was addressing an audience; this replies to them and the rest of the audience, but not the person who utters this word. This is a specifizing/narrowing of "{do'o}".
column5: you and the rest of the audience

column2: question word: which utterance?
column3: Parallels {do'i} and other cmavo from the {di'u} series. Answer can be a {di'u} cmavo or indeed any quote, usually a {lu} quote. See also {do'i}, {ma}.

column2: the last sumti having a {du'u}-abstraction at its topmost level inside
bridi abstractor: $x_1$ is the answer to the question $x_2$
column3: Experimental cmavo compound. Equivalent to {du'u} with {kau} attached to all question words (e.g. {ma}, {mo}, {xo}) contained. See {preti}, {danfu}, {du'umrei}

column2: $x_{1}$ is an elder/ancestor of $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/degree $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$'s generation precedes $x_{2}$'s parents.
$x_{1}$ reflects Antarctican culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
logical connective: sumti afterthought and.
attitudinal: \n{e'a} - granting permission\n{e'anai} - prohibiting.
attitudinal: \n{e'e} - competence\n{e'enai} - incompetence/inability.

attitudinal: 
{e'i} - feeling constraint
{e'icu'i} - independence
{e'inai} - challenge/resistance against constraint.
attitudinal: \n{ei} - obligation\n{einai} - freedom.
$x1$ performs chore / menial duty / housework / errand $x2$ (nu/ka) for purpose / as obliged by $x3$.
column3: Compare with {zdagu'a}, but much broader in scope, as not limited to house work.  Includes, for example, bills and shopping.  The little tasks we do to maintain our daily lives.  x3 is the motivation for doing the chore, compare {zukte}3.  Suggested rafsi: -zam- and also proposed to steal -dza- from {da}.  See also {bilga}, {gunka}. Generated with gismu algorithm: gismu[...]score.py dzaci, kama, tcor, lata, domashnie, rutini

column2: $x_1$ is recursively related to $x_2$ by applying $x_3$ (number) levels-of-recursion of the predicate-relation $x_4$ (ka with two ce'u)
column3: Rafsi -dzo- (when -dzo- is a tertau then seltau corresponds to $x_4$ of {dzoli}). Synonym of {refkusi} for more convenience in making lujvo. tanru example for common usage: 'the day three days from now (tomorrow's tomorrow's tomorrow)' is '{le} {bavlamdeidzo} {be} {fi} {li} {ci}'. Cf. {krefu}, {rapli}, {dzoli}.

column2: $x_1$ (li; often but not necessarily an integer) is a multiple of $x_2$ (li; often but not necessarily an integer) by some integer, namely $x_3$ (li; MUST be an integer in the structure; possibly, more than one input may be valid), in algebraic structure $x_4$.
column3: This is a {brapagjvo} of "{dzalene}" and "{pilji}". This word is not equivalent to "{mulpi'i}".

column2: $x_1$ [word/text] is a noun (a word referencing a thing (generic sense) and syntactically functioning as such) with meaning/referent $x_2$ in language $x_3$
column3: Nounness is an inherent property of the single word or phrase coupled with its meaning (although other such properties may exist for the word/phrase alone); it is not merely a role being assumed: the word with that meaning always is a noun in the language.

column2: $d_1$=$j_1$ reflects Loglandic/proto-Lojbanic language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $j_2$.
column3: Largely synonymous with {loglo}, but emphasizing Loglan's status as a precursor to Lojban.

column2: $s_1$=$d_2$=$l_2$ is a conservative in beliefs $l_3$ against opposition $s_3$ by means $s_4$
$si_1$ is a conservative political ideology as applied by $t_1$=$sa_1$=$d_2$=$l_2$ among/in people/territory/domain $t_2$ based on the works of thinker $si_3$
$k_1$ is classical.
$s_1$=$d_1$ is Celtic in aspect $s_2$.
$b_1$=$d_1$ crouches/squats/hunkers down.
$g_1$ lowers $d_1$ as compared with $d_2$ in reference frame $d_3$
$j_1$=$c_1$ (object/person) makes a deep dive beneath/below/under from $c_2$ (object/water surface) to depth $d_1$ in frame of reference $c_3$=$d_2$ by standard $d_3$, submerged in liquid $j_2$ .
$x_1$ is the bottom/lowest part of $x_2$
$x_1$ is a subharmonic/undertone of $x_2$; $x_1$ is utonal with respect to $x_2$.
column3: x1 and x2 can be frequencies, or pitch classes, or intervals. See also: {galto'a}.

column2: $x_1$ is a bass instrument (bass guitar, contrabass, bass horn, keyboard bass, washtub bass) of type $x_2$
$t_1$=$d_1$ is a shrub/bush of species $t_2$.
$x_1$ is a/the lower jaw of $x_2$.
column3: Not to be confused with mandible of a insect/other arthropod, which is {molja'u}. See also mandible/jawbone (={dzixejbo'u}).

column2: $b_1$ is a mandible/jawbone (mandibula) performing function $b_2$ in body of $b_3.$.
$x_1 = d_1 = c_1$ is a member of the class of birds which walk/run/hop as their characteristic/primary form of locomotion, of species/taxon $x_2 = c_2$
column3: $x_2$ should be enough to imply the environment in which these creatures live (and thus on what surfaces they walk) as well as the limbs with which they walk. These birds should essentially be flightless. Many ratites, penguins, and extinct species qualify; additionally, in some contexts, domesticated chickens and ducks might qualify (at least as {ta'e dzucpi}). Walking must be a fundamental characteristic of the bird. The class of such birds does not form a phylogenic tree or taxon; it is just a conceptual organizer/bin to be used for identifying birds with similar, fundamentally important, physical characteristics. The term "flightless bird" may be used, but the term is basically synonymous with his word only by circumstance/happenstance, not by logic: it is conceivable that, in another universe, there could exist a bird which is flightless but which does not primarily/characteristically walk; thus, flightless birds form a superclass which contains (modulo some fuzziness) dzucpi, but in reality, the relative complement of these classes is empty. See also: {voltolka'ecpi}

column2: $c_1$=$p_1$ is a pedestrian walking on road/path/surface $c_2$=$d_1$=$p_2$.
$g_1$ is a walking stick of material $g_2$.
$c_1$=$k_1$ walks to $k_2$ from $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using limbs $k_5$=$c_3$ on surface $c_2$
$k_1$=$c_2$ is a footpath at $k_2$ accessing $k_3$.
$m_1$ is a treadmill (industrial apparatus) performing process $m_2$.
$p_1$ is a procession with participation ordered/sequenced by rules $p_2$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is a foot/infantry soldier of army $s_2$.
$x_1$ is an open-mid front unrounded vowel sound produced by $x_2$.
column5: E sound;low-mid front unrounded vowel;open-mid front unrounded vowel

column2: $x_1$ is measured with vote-score $x_2$ (number) in upvote/downvote system $x_3$
column3: = se {nildzau}; made to match place structure of {klani} and unit-brivla. Refers to systems (chiefly on the Internet) that keep a running tally of approval-votes, and sometimes disapproval-votes as well. See {ma'udzau}, {ni'udzau}, {adzau}

column2: $x_1$ is tares of species/variety $x_2$.

$x_1$ and $x_2$ are mutual sibling nodes in a directed tree graph $x_6$ such that their shared parent node(s) $x_5$ is/are the most-recent common direct ancestor of $x_3$ and $x_4$, such that $x_1$ is a direct ancestor of or simply is $x_3$ (as the case may be), and such that $x_2$ is a direct ancestor of or simply is $x_4$ (as the case may be), all according to tree ordering relation $x_7$.
column3: $x_3$ and $x_4$ must be distinct nodes in the same directed tree; else this relationship is undefined. If $x_3$ is a direct ancestor of $x_4$, or vice-versa, then this relationship is  again  undefined. $x_6$ and $x_7$ define the relations/standards which are being applied. This word may be used in reference to non-familial tree graphs via analogy, despite references to 'siblings' etc. See also: "{tunba}", "{dzena}", "{treicu}", "{tseingu}", "{kraune}". At the time of creation, there was no commonly-recognized or succinct terminology, description, or phrase for this relationship in English to Curtis Franks' knowledge, other than something substantially similar to that which has been presented in the definition or gloss keywords.
column5: most-recent mutual-sibling direct ancestors;sibling branch progenitors

column2: $x_1$ is a red bean plant (Vigna angularis) of cultivar/variety/subtaxon $x_2$.
column3: For the bean itself, use "{dembi} be lo dzukicau"; append "{pesxu}" for the paste.

column2: $x_1$ asks permission to do/be $x_2$ (ka) from $x_3$
$x_1$ is allowable/permissible to $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
$x_1$ grants permission to/gives their consent to $x_2$ to do/be $x_3$ (ka)
$x_1$ is edgy by standard $x_2$.
$x_1$ is recursively related to $x_2$ by applying $x_3$ (number) levels-of-recursion of the predicate-relation $x_4$ (ka with two ce'u)
column3: Shortening of {refkusi} for more convenience in making V'y-style zi'evla-lujvo. tanru example for common usage: 'the day three days from now (tomorrow's tomorrow's tomorrow)' is '{lo} {bavlamdei} {efku} {be} {fi} {li} {ci}'. Cf. {krefu}, {rapli}, {efku}

column2: $x_1$ is ephemeric, lasting for a short period of time $x_2$; $x_1$ is ephemeral, temporary, transitory, fleeting, evanescent, momentary, short-lived, short, volatile

$x_1$ is a gnome of type $x_2$

Antarctic Ocean.
attitudinal: \n{e'a } - permission\n{e'a nai} - prohibition.
$x_1$ practices/exercises/studies/improves at doing/being $x_2$ by doing/being $x_3$
$x_1$ exhorts/encourages $x_2$ to do/be $x_3$
$x_1$ is a binary relation which is right-Euclidean on space/set/under conditions $x_2$.
column3: Definitionally, $x_1$ is an ordered binary relation given by set $R$ such that for all $a, b, c$ in $x_2$ (if such makes sense; else: the universe of discourse restricted by $x_2$), if $(a, b)$ in $R$ and $(a, c)$ in $R$, then $(b, c)$ in $R$ and $(c, b)$ in $R$. See also: "{takni}", ".{efklizu}".

column2: $x_1$ is a binary relation which is left-Euclidean on space/set/under conditions $x_2$.
column3: Definitionally, $x_1$ is a possibly-ordered binary relation given by set $R$ such that for all $a, b, c$ in $x_2$ (if such makes sense; else: the universe of discourse restricted by $x_2$), if $(b, a)$ in $R$ and $(c, a,)$ in $R$, then $(b, c)$ in $R$ and $(c, b)$ in $R$. See also: "{takni}", ".{efklipi}".

column2: $x_1$ gnaws on $x_2$
$x_1$ is an exoplanet revolving around $x_2$ with planetary characteristics $x_3$, orbital parameters $x_4$
Edinburgh
mix of .e'a (permission) + .e'e (encouragement) + .e'i (constraint) + .e'o (request) + .e'u (suggestion) + .au (desire)
letteral for e.
the alphabetic order used in South Semitic languages and sometimes in Ugaritic
naturalistic interjection: shy giggle
attitudinal: appeal/call/invocation/summoning
attitudinal: \n{e'e } - competence\n{e'e nai} - incompetence/inability.
{ei'au} - Attitudinal: heart melting and opening\n{ei'aucu'i} - unmoved\n{ei'aunai} - heart freezing and withdrawing

attitudinal: 
{e'i } - feeling constraint
{e'i cu'i} - independence
{e'i nai} - challenge/resistance against constraint.
$x_1$ is an ex-fianx of $x_2$ under custom/norm $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the former child of $x_2$ by law/custom/norm/standard $x_3$.
column3: This word can be used for disowned/ostracized/banished children (as a punishment or negative familial break), but it can also be used in cultures in which a person loses certain familial relationships after undergoing certain rites or fulfilling certain positive/neutral conditions. Additionally, if the child is adopted, or the parent stops fulfilling their parental duties (such as is the case for a deadbeat parent (see: "{malternrorci}"), or otherwise), or the parent or child dies, then this word could apply.

column2: $x_1$ is a former but not current spouse/ex-spouse of $x_2$ but law/norm/custom $x_3$.
column3: $x_3$ in its fullest form should specify at least both the basis for the spousal relationship when it existed as well as how it was terminated. Technically, this word does not preclude the possibility of widowhood/death of the spouse as being the cause of the termination of the spousal relationship.

column2: $x_1$ is the child of the ex-spouse of $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.
column3: Technically, any child co-parented or generated by $x_2$ and the ex-spouse would count so long as the spousal relationship is terminated; usually/conventionally, $x_2$'s own/direct children are excluded from the semantic coverage of this word however. $x_3$ covers the relevant parent-child relationship between $x_1$ and the former spouse, the terminated spousal relationship between $x_2$ and the ex-spouse, and the standard by which that spousal relationship was terminated. This word is a sort of opposite of the "step-" in "step-child".

column2: $x_1$ is a spouse of $x_2$'s former spouse by law/custom/standard $x_3$.
column3: Given that Lojban is elliptical on tense, any past, present, or future spouse of $x_2$'s spouse could technically be referenced; usually, we will explicitly exclude the possibility of $x_1 = x_2$ except possibly via remarriage; additionally, if $x_2$ were that person's nth spouse, then this word will typically (but not necessarily always) refer to a (n+m)th spouse of that same person, where n and m both are integer such that n > 1 and m > 1.
column5: ex-husband's new spouse;ex-spouse's spouse;ex-wife's new spouse

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'ek' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: NA? SE? A NAI?. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a former/previously was but no longer is/used to be (a) $x_2$ as of time $x_3$ according to standard $x_4$; $x_1$ is an ex-$x_2$.
column3: $x_2$ should be a role or possession of a property; unless $x_1$ is an or could be an event, it should not be one either (more generally, they have to match type in a sense). $x_4$ is the standard by which $x_2$ both was claimed (to have been) and is now no longer claimed (to be); cessation of the state of being an example of an $x_2$ must have occurred in the past and must still (in the present) not apply. It may be regained in the future, but this case is not considered, under normal circumstances, to be resumptive: the state was done/terminated (but not necessarily finished) and then may be started anew. See also: ".{uaigri}".

column2: $x_1$ (du'u/nu) should (moral obligation) be true/happen by standard $x_2$
column3: Brivla form of {ei}: "ei broda" = "lo su'u broda cu eilga". Merges {bilga}$_1$ and {bilga}$_2$. See {einvi}, {zgadi}, {sarcu}

column2: $x_1$ instructs/indicates to $x_2$ to do/be $x_3$
$x_1$ is a gender role for boys in culture $x_2$; in culture $x_2$, typical boys are obliged to do $x_1$.
$x_1$ (agent) thinks $x_2$ (du'u/nu) should (moral obligation) be true/happen about subject/issue $x_3$ on grounds $x_4$
$x_1$=$l_1$ is a to-do-list for $x_2$; $x_1$=$l_1$ is a list of things that $x_2$ needs/is obligated to do
$x_1$ is a gender role for girls in culture $x_2$; in culture $x_2$, typical girls are obliged to do $x_1$.
$x_1$ is a clown
$x_1$ is the return value of a function without body (with possibly more arguments)
column3: $x_1$ can be void. Two main interrelated usage cases: 1. wrapped into a sumti and used as a dummy predicate to fill in arguments of higher-order functions with stricter typing of its argument, for which {ekfu} is used. Similar to the concept of object in object-oriented programming. 2. as type-signature template.

column2: $x_1$ is the informational viewing area of output device $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is related to/associated with/akin to the exterior of $x_2$ by relationship $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is an exclave of $x_2$
$x_1$ (set, list) excludes/does not contain $x_2$.
column3: Agentively exclude/"reject" = .{ekskludi'ygau}; "to be mutually contradictory with" is a distinct sense. See also: {skudi}.

column2: $x_1$ expects $x_2$ (property of $x_3$) from $x_3$
$x_1$ is explicit, directly expressed, apparent, readily observable, leaving nothing implied
$x_1$ (entity) exports $x_2$ (entity) to $x_3$ (entity)
$x_1$ is an elf of type $x_2$
$x_1$ reflects LGBT+/non-normative sexuality/gender expression/identity in aspect $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a helicopter
$x_1$ is a thunk for computing expression $x_2$
$x_1$ is a song.
$x_1$ is a song with music/melody $x_2$ and lyrics $x_3$
$x_1$ is a lateral (phonetic) sound
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'tag' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: tense-modal (joik-jek tense-modal)*. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'space' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: VA & space-offset+ & space-interval & (MOhI space-offset). For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a gun for use by $x_2$ against $x_3$, launching material $x_4$
column3: like {celxa'i} but not a jvajvo or a lujvo at all. doesn't include everything that "{cecla} {gi'e} {xarci}", but only guns. somewhat similar to {cladaxi} in relation with {cmacelxa'i}. x4 is not necessarily a bullet: it could be a laser, or fire, or anything that could be shot from a gun.

column2: $x_1$ is an mbira/kalimba/thumb piano tuned to $x_2$, with playing range $x_3$, of material $x_4$
$x_1$ is an emic unit abstracted from etic unit/set of units $x_2$ in theoretical field/according to theoretical model $x_3$; $x_1$ is emic.
column3: Counterpart to {etkuni} 'etic unit'; synonymous with {se} {etkuni}. A distinction between 'emic' and 'etic' units is made in many schools of linguistics. (A very different emic-etic distinction is used in anthropology and sociology, referring to contrasting approaches to field research.) The terms derive from 'phonemic' and 'phonetic'. The phoneme is the prototypical emic unit; it is a meaningful entity abstracted from a class of physically distinct sounds (allophones), which are its constituent 'etic' units. A distinction is likewise made between morphemes (emic) and allomorphs (etic), and between graphemes and glyphs. Other emic terms that have seen academic use include 'grammeme', 'sememe', 'noeme', 'tagmeme', and 'taxeme'.

column2: $x_1$ (n-ary property) is applied to sumti $x_2$, $x_3$, ...
column3: Can have infinite places (specifically n+1, if $x_1$ is an n-ary property). {brivla} parallel of {me'au}.

column2: $x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$ in feeling $x_3$; $x_1$ has empathy
$x_1$ varies in what it is in relation $x_2$ with.
$x_1$ is a hippopotamus (Hippopotamus amphibius), hippo of variety $x_2$
$x_1$ (digit string/byte, storage system, convention) has endianness $x_2$ ("ce'o" sequence of numbers (li); description (ka?)); $x_1$ is $x_2$-endian.
column3: For filling $x_2$ with a "{ce'o}" sequence, the following convention is used: 1 (li pa) represents the most important/significant term in the actual number and the significance of the term is inversely proportional with the size of the number representing it in the sequence; the sequence will be as short as possible, will have no blank spaces, and each term in it will be a positive integer such that, if there are at least two terms, for any term, there exists another term which differs from it by 1; the placement of a term in the sequence indicates the location of a generic term in an actual number with the signficance which is represented by it, in the given base. For example, "li pa ce'o li re" means "big-endian" (the most significant term (represented by "li pa") comes first in the sequence and the sequence has exactly two terms), "li re ce'o li pa" means "little-endian" ((the most significant term (represented by "li pa") comes last in the sequence and the sequence has exactly two terms), "li re ce'o li ci ce'o le pa" is middle-endian (as in the conventional representation of dates in the U.S. (MM-DD-YYYY); the second most signifant term (represented by "li re"; example: month) comes first, the least significant term (represented by "li ci"; example: day) comes second, and the most significant term (represented by "li pa"; example: year) comes last, and there are exactly three terms), "li pa ce'o li ci ce'o li re" is the reverse of the last (example: YYYY-DD-MM). The point is that, while it is cumbersome, this method of filling $x_2$ is generalizable and explicit. "Bi-endian" (traditional sense) can be specified by a judicious usage of the word ".{a}" between the little-endian and big-endian sequences; less conventional endiannesses which could be described as being "bi-endian" or even "$n$-endian" can be formed by different or more elaborate connectives between such sequences; just worry about grouping of connectives. See also: {kau'ai}, {kau'au}.

column2: $x_1$ is related to/associated with/akin to something what is in/inside/within $x_2$ by relationship $x_3$.
$x_1$ abstractly pertains to an exponential/root/logarithmic relationship between the elements of $x_2$ (ordered pair) which are related via concrete relationship $x_3$.
column3: When discussing the so-called 'Triangle of Power' (see, for example: https://youtu.be/sULa9Lc4pck ), this term is useful, as it briefly encapsulates every possible role which the Triangle may denote/act. Each operator ({tenfa}, {fenfa}, and {dugri}) is a binary operator; $x_3$ specifies which of these operators is being used (modulo SE conversions), and $x_2$ will provide the operands thereof in the order of the inputs given by $x_3$. Notice that lo tenfa, lo fenfa, and lo dugri are all the answers/results of applying the respective operators to an ordered pair of inputs (given by their respective second and third terbri, each); thus, none of these constructs ("lo X") can be submitted to $enfa_3$, which only accepts the operator (not the result of the operator). Either use mekso and {mau'au}-{zai'ai} quote the desired VUhU word ({te'a}, {fe'a}, or {du'o}, or their SE conversions), or use a tanru/lujvo in order to create words for "exponentiation operator", "root operator", or "logarithm operator" (or their SE conversions) in order to fill $enfa_3$.

column2: $x_1$ happens in universe-of-discourse $x_2$
column3: Proposed alternate definition of {fasnu}. See {munje}, {enzasti}, {li'i'e}. $x_2$ can be {lo} {fatci}, or a system, real or imagined, including a "story universe".

column2: $x_1$ is an architect/designer/engineer of $x_2$

column3: Used to more precisely express relationship (whether fuzzy or not) between terbricmi (predicate slots) and arguments (sumti) filling those slots.  See also {ckini}, {va'e}, {jei}, {sela'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is an (arbitrary) $x_2$-set (li) of superset $x_3$; $x_1$ is subset/subgroup/subcategory/subclass/vel sim. of $x_3$ with cardinality/size $x_2$.
column3: $x_1$ is empty if(f) $x_2 = 0$, which is possible; $x_1$ may or may not be a proper substructure ({praperi}) of $x_3$. $x_2$ is a nonnegative cardinal. The two distinguishing features of $x_1$ are its size ($x_2$) and the object/structure ($x_3$) to which it belongs/which contains it. Any $x_2$ elements of $x_3$ can belong to $x_1$ as long as the total count is correct; no particular collection is necessarily included. It is bad form for $x_2$ to strictly exceed the size/cardinality of $x_3$ and, necessarily, no such object/structure can exist. See also: {klesi}, {praperi}, {cletu}.

column2: $x_1$ (text) is written in a dialect where every bridi has arguments expressed in content/patient/recipient/stimulus semantic cases schema
column3: Labels of roles: {fa} for content, {fe} for patient, {fi} for recipient, {fo} for stimulus, {ja'i} for the rules describing the semantic cases schema. Additional semantic cases might be used, e.g. {sepi'o} (instrument role), {ri'i} (experiencer role), {ri'a} (enabler role), {gau} (agent role). To be used with {sei}. To use only for a given bridi without affecting child bridi the transformation 'SELBRI => SELBRI .ensi' can be used (as an alternative to using {sei}) thus putting {ensi} as the tertau of a newly formed selbri. See also {jo'au}, {ilki}, {esme}, {onga}.

column3: Any type of entropy (specified by $x_4$, tanru, "{pe}", etc.) is allowed, not just Boltzmann entropy (= ".{entropi} {foi'e} {pe} {la} .boltsman."); Boltzmann entropy should be named as such; the entropy need not be logarithmic. $x_2$ must be a system in the physical sense. See also: {boltsemaku}, {ciste}, {kalte}, {cunso}, {zildatni}.

column2: $x_1$, in aspect $x_2$, reflects the culture/lifestyle/people of a non-native (immigrant/invading/alien) population/culture $x_3$ which at least partially but significantly and somewhat permanently (having established itself) locally supplanted, displaced, or dominated the indigenous/native culture $x_4$ in region $x_5$ (location)
column3: Native American cultures  ({rindo}) would qualify as $x_3$, with  $x_5$ being a superset of the Americas ({bemjoitco}), whereas the Euramerican cultures that replaced them would be $x_3$. Foreignness/indigenosity are not sufficient; the foreign population (and, even more importantly, culture) must come to dominate the indigenous one, at least locally.

$x_1$is an etic unit/set of units forming emic unit $x_2$ in theoretical field/according to theoretical model $x_3$; $x_1$ is etic.
column3: Counterpart to {emkuni} 'emic unit'; synonymous with {se} {emkuni}. A distinction between 'emic' and 'etic' units is made in many schools of linguistics. (A very different emic-etic distinction is used in anthropology and sociology, referring to contrasting approaches to field research.) The terms derive from 'phonemic' and 'phonetic'. The allophone is the prototypical etic unit; several physically distinct allophones, or vocal sounds, are perceived as one linguistically meaningful unit, or phoneme (an emic unit). Allomorphs and glyphs are analogous etic units in morphology and grammatology, respectively.

$x_1$ is an n-ary operator/map which is distributive/linear/homomorphic in or over or from space/structure $x_2$, mapping to space or structure $x_3$, thereby producing a new space/structure $x_4$ which is the 'union' of $x_2$ and $x_3$ endowed with $x_1$; $x_1$ distributes over/through all of the operators of $x_2$.
column3: $x_2$ and $x_3$ cannot merely be sets; they must be structures/systems which each are a set/category endowed with at least one operator/relation/property (here, "operator" will refer to any of these options) each; the $i$th operator endowing one space corresponds to exactly the ith operator endowing the other space under mapping $x_1$. For any operator of $x_2$, $x_1$ is commutative with it with respect to functional composition ({fa'ai}) when the (other) operator is 'translated' to the corresponding operator of $x_3$ appropriately. $x_1$ is linear/a linear operator; $x_1$ is a homomorphism; $x_1$ distributes. $x_2$ is homomorphic with $x_3$ under $x_1$; they need not be identical (in fact, their respective operators need not even be identical, just 'homomorphically similar'). For "distributivity"/"distributive property", "linearity of operator", or "homomorphicity of operator", use "ka(m)( )facni" with $x_1$ filled with "{ce'u}"; for "homomorphicity of spaces", use the same thing, but with $x_2$ or $x_3$ filled with "{ce'u}". See also: "{socni}", "{cajni}", "{sezni}", "{dukni}"; "{fa'ai}"; "{fatri}". This is a structure-operator-preserving function, and thus is an example of a {stodraunju}.
column5: distributive function;distributive operator;distributive property;graph homomorphism;homomorphicity;homomorphism;linear function;linear map;linear operator

column2: $d_1$ is jazz music performed at/by $z_2$ (event) with characteristics $z_3$.
$x_1$ is a bagel of type $x_2$ (ka)
column3: The x2 can be used to specify toppings such as sesame seeds or poppy seeds, and it can be used to specify a regional variety e.g. Montreal-style vs New York-style.

column2: $x_1$ is a shish kebab, shashlyk, a dish consisting of meat $x_2$ threaded on a skewer and grilled
$x_1$ is a jaguar (Panthera onca) of subspecies/breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is involved in event $x_2$
column3: Possibly synonymous to {pagbu}, but may actually have a different nuance.

column2: $x_1$ is a caiman of genus/species $x_2$
Tautological/empty/vacuous predicate; it is true regardless of what and how many arguments are given to it; something is the case; $x_1$ is a thing / is anything; $x_1$ and $x_2$ are in any relation.
$x_1$ is an integer.
$x_1$ suggests/advices $x_2$ to do/be $x_3$
$x_1$ (record, movie) has the dimension $x_2$ (ka)
column3: $x_1$ can be {vreji}, {skina}, {draci}. $x_2$ can specify length in time, space dimensions of its frames ({kantu}). See also {tcidu}, {skicu}, {zgana}, {ze'a}, {temci}, {canlu}.

column2: $x_1$ is a place erased from the place structure of the parent predicate according to the rules $x_2$ (property of all the places of the parent predicate including the one filled with $x_1$)
column3: Default value of $x_2$ is either specified in the definition of the parent predicate or assumed from context. '.i broda le ezli' is equal to '.i broda {zi'o}'.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'space-offset' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: FAhA NAI? VA?. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a fa'afafine of species $x_2$ evidencing fa'afafine trait(s) $x_3$ (ka)
Chinese checkers
Denali
diwata (Philippines), god, spirit, fairy
Jakarta
Gilles Deleuze
Fido.
$x_1$ is PA hours in duration by standard $x_2$.
column3: Example "pu lo re coi'e" meaning "two hours ago". See also {cacra}, {nei'o}, {lei'o}, {jei'o}, {doi'e}, {moi'e}, {soi'e}, {cei'a}.

column2: asks the listener to provide a word matching the preceding description being the seltau
elliptical/vague/unspecific/generic tanru inversion
column3: References some (possibly multiple) cmavo in selma'o CO. Unlike most other ellipticals, the default value is not elliptical, so this word cannot be omitted/implicit; it must be explicit.

column2: Combination of {coi} and {co'o}, indicating either greetings or partings according to context; may also constitute a greeting in passing (such as {coico'o}).
column3: The scalar negated forms of this COI are apparently identical to its positive form. cf. {coi}, {co'o}, {rinsa}, {tolrinsa}.

column2: interval event contour: premature cessation; done although not finished; at the ending point of ... even though not completed.
column3: This is a shade of "{co'u}"; whereas "co'u" can cover any cessation (completed or otherwise), this word definitively and affirmatively indicates that completion has not been achieved.

column2: tanru inversion question: asks for a CO cmavo.
binary mathematical operator: vector norm/magnitude of vector $a$ in structure (normed vector space) $b$.
column3: Contextless default for $b$: Euclidean normed vector space over the reals or complexes; in relativity, without context, the default interpretation for a four-vector is the Minkowski magnitude. $b$ determines the meaning of the norm. Accompanies and clarifies "{cu'a}".

column2: universal famyma'o: terminates the most recently opened construct or clause.
column3: cu'au looks back for the most recently opened construct that has not been terminated, and emulates whatever {famyma'o} would terminate it. It can also be subscripted with {xi}, and will terminate that many times. Note that that means grammatical function is being put in a {xi} clause, so be careful when using it. Additionally, cu'au {xi} {ro} will terminate all the way up to the last sentence-starting word (.i mi klama lo zarci pe lo pendo be mi cu'au xi ro -> .i mi klama lo zarci pe lo pendo be mi cu'au-be'o-ku-ge'u-ku-vau). This will also terminate to sentences started in {lu} (will NOT emulate li'u UNLESS used multiple times), {ni'o}, and {no'i}. It will NOT emulate {le'u}. In addition to {ro}, it can be subscripted with {da'a}, which terminates to the sentence level, minus 1. In the previous example, this would just leave the {vau} remaining, and allow you to continue to add to the place structure of {klama}.

column2: mekso binary/unary operator:  multinomial coefficient/binomial coefficient/choose
column3: If unary, a list (n_1,...,n_r) must be supplied as input; the terms of the list may not be distinct; for appropriate values, output is ((n_1 +...+ n_r)!)/((n_1)! *...* (n_r)!). If binary, a single number n must be supplied for the first variable and the second variable must be a list (k_1,...,k_s); for appropriate values, the output is (n!)/((k_1 !) * ((n - k_1)!) *...* (k_s !) * ((n - k_s)!)); note that this is not exactly the typical definition, but it allows for easier immediate usage for the binomial case (where s=1).

column2: Cancellation (instant-/usage-wise; temporary) of all defaults in immediately previous word
column3: Cancels/overrides/ignores/"kills" all defaults (default specifications) in the (terbri) structure of immediately previously uttered word so that implicit/omitted {zo'e} and{diau} that may fill the terbri of that word are general in potential reference (modulo context) and do not necessarily agree with the default setting explicitly specified in the discourse-external/official definition of the word. The terbri are not filled by this word. Usage is only meaningful for a brivla with at least one terbri (regardless of being explicitly filled or otherwise). In a tanru or other complicated construct, only the most recent word undergoes this terbri default override (not every term in the construct). A selbri converted to a sumti by gadri has the x1 terbri filled for the purposes of this word, but the default setting of that terbri is so overridden all the same; likewise is the case for terbri accessed by {be} or {bei}; seltau in the main level of a sumti are filled by the gadri as well for the purposes of this word. The cancellation is only effective for the single occurrence/instant/usage of this word (the next use of the affected word will be implicitly accompanied by its terbri defaults, as defined elsewhere (by official definition or by other (permanent) modifications made to the word)). See also: {doi'a}, {de'au}, {zmico}.

column2: pro-sumti & sumyzmico: discourse-exterior default it
column3: Explicitly and emphatically references the specified default value of the relevant terbri as given by "official" definitions (exterior to the discourse); this value ignores and is independent of any modifications made to the relevant default specification during the discourse. (zo'e, implicit or explicit, may do so as well, but the use of this word implies some degree of a more deliberate choice to follow the discourse-exterior default specification.) When a default is not specified by the definition of a word, this word is equivalent to completely general and elliptical {zo'e}. See also: {di'au}, {di'ei}, {zmico}.

column2: digit/number: twenty (decimal 20).
letteral for e.
column3: Synonymous with the original CLL definition of .{ebu}.

column2: mathematical ordered n-ary operator: (pointwise) functional left composition; $X_1 \circ X_2$.
column3: Inputs must be appropriate functions; this outputs a function; follow by "{ku'e} ({boi})" in order to include/apply the output function to arguments (thereby producing a number). $a_1 \circ a_2 \circ \dots \circ a_n = a_1(a_2(\dots(a_n(\cdot))\dots))$ for any positive integer or countable infinity $n$ and functions $a_i$ for all integer $i < n+1$. Replaces all of the inputs with a (possibly stripped, as appropriate) tuple; for replacing a single argument in a multivariate function with a function (either evaluated or not), use (partial) (e)valuation. Left compose multiple terms by separating the function names with "{boi}".

column2: mekso k-ary operator, for natural k and 1 < k < 5: ordered input $(f, g, S, m)$ where $f$ and $g$ are functions, $S$ is a set of positive integers or "ro" (="all"), and $m$ is 0 or 1 (as a toggle); output is a function equivalent to the function $f$ as applied to an input ordered tuple with $g$ applied to the entries/terms with indices in $S$ (or to all entries/terms if $S$="ro") if $m$=$0$, or $g$ left-composed with the same if $m$=$1$.
column3: $S$="ro" is default case (making this operator binary or ternary); $S$ must be a set or "ro" (no bare integers); $m$ = 0 is the default case (making this operator binary or ternary); use "{mau'au}" and "{zai'ai}" in order to quote $f$ and $g$ each; the indices in the implicit tuple mentioned in the definition are positive natural numbers such that said tuple is of form $(x_1, x_2, x_3, ..., x_n, ...)$; thus, notationally, a concrete output of this function, as applied to the aforementioned concrete input tuple, is of form $($fa'ai'ai$(f, g, S, m))(x_1, x_2, ..., x_n, ...)$. For example, maintaining this notation, if $S$="ro" and $m$=$0$, then the output is $f(g(x_1), g(x_2), ..., g(x_n), ...)$; if $S$ = Set(1, 3, 23) and $m$=$0$, then the output is $f(g(x_1), x_2, g(x_3), x_4, x_5, ..., x_{21}, x_{22}, g(x_{23}), x_{24}, x_{25}, ..., x_n, ...)$; vel sim. If $h$ is the function output by this expression when $m$=$0$, then for the same inputs (ignoring $m$), $g \circ h$ is the function output by the same expression but with $m$=$1$. Obviously, in order to be meaningful, the output of each step along the way must be defined. If $S$ is the empty set and $g$ is defined, then the output is just the function $f$ if $m$=$0$. The output of this operator is a function, so it must have explicit input supplied to it ("it" here referring to the output of this operator) in order to actually have an explicit and concrete result; use mathematical brackets around this operator and its inputs when doing so, particularly when $S$ or $m$ is omitted (as being equal to the default "ro" or 0 resp.).

column2: mathematical unary operator: map notation
column3: Input is unary: a function f; the output is an ordered tuple: (the domain set of f, the codomain set of f, the image of f, the mapping rule of f (defined with a dummy variable which is taken to belong to the the domain set of f), the graph/plot (set of input-output pairs) of f). Might be useful for lambda calculus, etc. Equip the output with {ma'o} in order to use as a/the function. Extract a term in the tuple in order to use it directly.

column2: nonce place; tags sumti with an unspecified connection to the bridi
column3: This is used as a shorthand for the cmavo-compound faxinoboi, which allows arbitrary quantification of variables in a bridi outside of the prenex, giving them a defined scope. Each usage is a new unspecified place for the bridi it appears in, multiple usages do not have overlapping places.

column2: Unary mekso operator: reverse finite ordered sequence, tuple, list, string, etc.

{fai'a} - translation marker\n{fai'anai} - original/native version: marks a construct as having been translated and therefore particularly (possibly, but not necessarily) susceptible to the errors or limitations associated with translation (especially if the translator is unsure of the best result/option)
column3: Might be useful for translations of idioms, songs, poetry, wordplay, political speeches, nuanced phrasings, (in stories) prophecies, riddles, rhymes, etc. Followed by members of selma'o CAI, the marker indicates the corresponding level of uncertainty in the best possible choice of translation according to the opinion/expectation/judgment of the speaker/translator. Also may indicate a cultural or linguistic gap. For Lojban especially, it might be useful when various ambiguities arise in the original text and the translator is forced to pick interpretations from among them.

column2: digit/number: the second Feigenbaum constant  = 2.502907875095892822283902873218...
digit/number: first Feigenbaum constant= 4.669 201 609 102 990 671 853 203 821 578(...).

Pendent preposition. Introduces a dangling argument that doesn't take part in the surrounding argument structure; similarly to {zo'u}, it may be used for pre-declaring a quantification, or for introducing an argument that will be later referred to anaphorically. The pronoun {zoi'i} is automatically bound to the argument introduced by {fai'i}.

Creates a predicate abstraction sumti out of a full bridi clause, binding all the necessary lambda variables to the ko'a-ko'u pronoun series. The number of bound variables must be indicated by appending {xi} followed by that number to the word {fo'ai}, unless only one variable (namely {fo'a}) is bound, in which case the {xi} marking is optional.
column3: lo ka ce'u ce'u ce'u broda (ku) = "fo'ai xi ci fo'a fo'e fo'i broda (ku'au)". In the rare cases where more than five lambda variables are needed, fo'a xi PA might be used. See also ko'ai, ce'ai.

column2: GOI attachment modifier: allows a cmavo of selma'o GOI (which must follow immediately) to be attached to a selbri
column3: This word must (ignoring quotes, etc.) be preceded by a selbri (to which it immediately attaches, even in sumti) and must be followed by a member of selma'o GOI (ignoring erasure, etc.). All other semantics and syntax of the GOI construct remains the same, it just applies to the selbri immediately prior to this word, rather than a sumti. See also: {po'oi}.

column2: create a relation abstraction sumti out of a full bridi clause, binding the two lambda variables to the {fo'i} and {fo'u} pronouns.
digit/number: first Foias' constant; the unique value of $x_1$ such that $x_n$  ->  as n ->  for $x_{n+1}  = (1 + (1/( x_n )))^n$; such $x_1$ = 1.187
digit/number: second Foias constant; the value x for which $(1/x)(1 + (1/x))^x=1$ is true;  2.293

discursive: 
{fu'au} - luckily
{fu'aucu'i} - not pertaining to luck
{fu'aunai} - unluckily.
column3: Expresses fortune/misfortune of the speaker. Use {dai} to express fortune/misfortune of the listener. See also {funca}.

column2: begin within-context quote.
column3: Terminated by {fu'o}. Quoted text need not be grammatical on its own, but must be grammatical in context with the surrounding text.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'a; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'e; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'i; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'o; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'u; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: $x1$ pertains to Levallois (Mousterian) technological industry/culture/know-how of period and location (specifics) $x2$ in properties $x3$; $x1$ exhibits Levallois (Mousterian) craft/technique/practice
$x_1$ is the selma'o "UI".
$c_1$ is an elephant bird (genus Aepyornis) of species $c_2$.
$c_1$ is a cassowary bird (genus Casuarius) of species $c_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances twist to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ is a locust bean from plant [legume] $d_2$ (Ceratonia siliqua).
column3: Locust beans, are used as animal feed, and are the source of locust bean gum (={vikrceratonia}).

column2: $x_1$ is (a/some) krill [member of malacostracan crustacean order: Euphausiacea] of subtaxon/type/genus/species/variety/breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is a fortepiano
attitudinal modifier: \n{fu'i } - easy\n{fu'i nai} - difficult.
$x_{1}$ (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is buoyant.
$x_{1}$ (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of $x_{2}$; (note mabla/zabna not implied). $x_{1}$ is determined by chance.
$x_{1}$ rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is rotten/decayed/fermented.
$x_{1}$ is responsible/accountable for $x_{2}$ (action/resulting state) to judge/authority $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu.  'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is industry/industrial/systematic manufacturing activity producing $x_{2}$ by process/means $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [person] labors/works on/at $x_{2}$ [activity] with goal/objective $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is a worker/laborer.  (cf. {sazri}, {gasnu}, {se} {jibri}; {zukte} - which need not be labor; physics term 'work' = {ni} {muvyselbai}, {briju}, {jibri}, {lazni}, {selfu})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mass/team/aggregate/whole, together composed of components $x_{2}$, considered jointly.
column3: A description in $x_1$ indicates of mass property(ies) displayed by the mass; masses may reveal properties not found in the individual set members that are massified, which themselves are not necessarily relevant to the mass property implicit in this bridi.  See also {bende}, {girzu}, {pagbu}, cmavo list {loi}, {lei}, {lai}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {kansa}, {tinci}, {mulgunma}.

column2: $x_{1}$ rolls/trundles on/against surface $x_{2}$ rotating on axis/axle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a roller.
$x_{1}$ is a goose/[gander] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/mass) attacks/invades/commits aggression upon victim $x_{2}$ with goal/objective $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.
column3: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
column3: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cushions $x_{2}$ with material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a cushion/pillow/pad [for $x_{2}$] of padding material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear $x_{2}$ [transmission].
column3: Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}).  (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type $x_{2}$ [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].
column3: Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
column3: Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cone [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$ with vertex $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of $x_{2}$ next-to/bordering-on $x_{3}$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cork/bark from tree/species $x_{2}$; [material].
$x_{1}$ is a coat/jacket/sweater/cloak/[cape/shawl/pullover] [extra outer garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).
column3: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial.  See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.

column2: $x_{1}$ represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] $x_{2}$ in matter(s)/function(s) $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: on behalf of.  See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) is the $x_{3}$'rd recurrence/repetition of $x_{2}$ (abstract); $x_{2}$ happens again in [form] $x_{1}$.
column3: Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion.  See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.
column3: without evidence refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction.  See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition $x_{2}$ in form/arrangement $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {jemna}, {bisli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).
column3: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.
$x_{1}$ intersects/crosses/traverses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
column3: [$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions $x_{2}$ (def. 3), surfaces/sides $x_{3}$ (def. 6).
column3: (cf. {kurfa} - needed for 'cube', {bliku} for a physical object; {tanbo}, {tapla}, {tarmi})

column2: $x_{1}$ is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
$x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense $x_{2}$ [person, or sensory activity].
$x_{1}$ [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos $x_{2}$ (mass); $x_{1}$ is ethnic.
column3: (note that $x_2$ is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait).  See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a room of/in structure $x_{2}$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a camel/llama/alpaca/vicuna/dromedary of species/breed $x_{2}$.
column3: Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}).  See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal $x_{2}$ mined from location/lode/mine $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [container] is empty/vacant of $x_{2}$ [material]; $x_{1}$ is hollow.
column3: Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada).  See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices $x_{2}$, dimensions $x_{3}$ (default 2).
column3: Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}).  See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).
column3: Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$.  See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is bitter/acrid/sharply disagreeable to observer/sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ ranges/extends/spans/persists/reaches across/over interval/gap/area/scope/extent/range $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is cruel/mean/unkind to victim $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wolf/lupine of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pulls/tugs/draws/drags $x_{2}$ by handle/at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ relies/depends/counts on/trusts $x_{2}$ to bring about/ensure/maintain $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
column3: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_{1}$ (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ with fastener $x_{4}$.
column3: No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Latin/Roman/Romance culture/empire/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lotus, plant/flower/herb of species/strain $x_{2}$ symbolizing $x_{3}$ to culture/religion $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is lazy/avoiding work/effort concerning action $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ takes/gets/gains/obtains/seizes/[removes] $x_{2}$ (object/property) from $x_{3}$ (possessor).
column3: Also confiscate, appropriate.  Acquire with volition such that $x_1$ gains possession; $x_3$ is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied.  (cf. {punji}, {cpacu} where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, {vimcu} for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, {canci}, {cliva})

column2: end indicator long scope; terminates scope of all active indicators.
n-ary mathematical operator: elliptical/unspecified mathematical expression (mex) operator.
letteral for f.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal or (with gi).
{zgana} modal, 1st place                            to observer ... ; witnessed by ...
upper-case letteral shift.

attitudinal modifier/honorific: 
{ga'i} - hauteur; used with one of lower rank.
{ga'icu'i} - equal rank
{ga'inai} - meekness
digit/number: hex digit C (decimal 12) [twelve].
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought question (with gi).
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if (with gi).

attitudinal: 
{i'e} - approval
{i'ecu'i} - non-approval
{i'enai} - disapproval.
attitudinal: \n{ie} - agreement\n{ienai} - disagreement.
attitudinal: \n{i'i} - togetherness\n{i'inai} - privacy.
attitudinal: \n{ii} - fear\n{iinai} - security.
attitudinal: \n{i'o} - appreciation\n{i'onai} - envy.
attitudinal: \n{io} - respect\n{ionai} - disrespect.
attitudinal: \n{i'u} - familiarity\n{i'unai} - mystery.

attitudinal: 
{iu} - love
{iucu'i} - no love lost
{iunai} - hatred.
vocative: please repeat.
discursive: \n{ke'u} - repeating\n{ke'unai} - continuing.
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.
vocative: \n{ki'e} - thanks\n{ki'enai} - no thanks to you.
{ckini} modal, 1st place (related to)               relatively; as a relation of ...
pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #1 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #2 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #3 (specified by goi).
{korbi} modal, 1st place (bordered by)              bounded by ...
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #4 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #5 (specified by goi).
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
non-logical connective: intersection of sets.
elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.
discursive: however/but/in contrast.
elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause; always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.
{kulnu} modal, 1st place                            in culture ...
letteral for k.
name descriptor: the one(s) called ... ; takes name or selbri description.
discursive: \n{la'a} - probability\n{la'anai} - improbability.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
{klani} modal, 1st place (amount)                   quantifying ...; being a quantity of ...
2-word letteral/shift: punctuation mark or special symbol follows.
non-veridical descriptor: the one(s) described as ...
{klesi} modal, 1st place (scalar set)               in/of category ...
non-veridical descriptor: the stereotype of those described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
non-veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) described as ...
$x_1$ is a loanword meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$, based on word $x_4$ in language $x_5$.
$x_1$ is a mushroom of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is $10^{(-30)}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is represents Celtic culture in aspect $x_2$
column3: Not necessarily confined to the British Isles. See also: {skoto}.

column2: $k_1$ is a quantity of cake/torte/tart/pie/flan made of/containing ingredients $k_2$, prepared according to method $k_3$.
$x_1$ (state/event/fact) is fair/just/righteous to $x_2$ according to $x_3$
column3: According to $x_3$, the way $x_2$ is treated in $x_1$ is just (it is "as things should be"). See also {pajni}, {sarxe}, {vrude}, {vudypai}, {nutli}, {pairnu'i}. (Many of those words deal with some judge acting "fairly" or "justly" in some matter, which kerni does not. In fact, a "to'e kerni" (unfair) situation is not necessarily the result of evil, may be considered unfair to all parties, and may be nobody's fault.)

column2: $x_1$ (property of $x_2$) is a stereotype of $x_2$ (object/set), held by $x_3$
column3: Does not necessarily carry a negative connotation. Stereotypes are, basically, the characteristics that come to one's mind when they imagine a particular object, regardless of actual commonality. e.g. Many people stereotypically think of roses as red, even though there are plenty of roses that aren't red. See {sei'i}, {lemkai}, {le'e}

column2: $x_{1}$ is $10^{30}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ pertains to the internet/cyberspace in aspect $x_2$.
column3: Proposed by xorxes. Short rafsi -kib-. Cf. {mujysamseltcana}.

column2: $x_1$ (set/space) is closed under(/wrt) operator/relation $x_2$; $x_2$ has closure in $x_1$.
column3: Identical to {klojere} but is a gismu (as it might be considered to be a fairly fundamental concept which is productive).

column2: $x_1$ is a coconut of variety/cultivar $x_2$
$x_1$ (set/shape) is convex in sense $x_2$.
column3: A function cannot really be convex (its epigraph can be though). This word is the gismu form of "{konvexi}".

column2: $s_1$ is a crow/raven of species $s_2$.
column3: See {cipnrkorvo} for a non-experimental version of this word.

column2: $x_1$ (abstraction) is a purpose/use of $x_2$ (object or event), attributed by $x_3$
column3: Place structure has been inverted from the original version to match {krinu}. Syn. {erpi}. See {ko'au}, {terpli}, {terzu'e}, {terfi'i}

column2: $x_1$ (NU) is a legal/moral entitlement of $x_2$ (individual/mass) by standard $x_3$. $x_2$ is a legal person.
column3: Normative principles, variously construed as legal, social, or moral freedoms or entitlements. {rarkrali} for "natural rights and {flakrali} for "legal rights"; {xuskrali} for "claim rights" and {zifkrali} for "liberty rights"; {srakrali} for "positive rights" and {ri'urkrali}/{badykrali} for "negative rights"; {sepkrali} for "individual rights" and {gumkrali} for "group rights"; {selcemkrali} for "civil rights" and {seljeckrali} for "political rights"; {jiknykrali} for "economic rights", {jikykrali} for "social rights", and {klukrali} for "cultural rights"; {remkrali} for "human rights" and {dalkrali} for "animal rights"; perhaps {kralyxai} for "violate". Cf. {selfla}, {selzi'e}, {terzi'e}, {selzau}, {selpikta}.

column2: $x_1$ is the core/nub/essence/heart/true part of entity/body/building/thing $x_2$

$x_1$ is orthogonal/perpendicular/right/at right angle/rectified/square/normal to $x_2$, where they (are projected to) intersect orthogonally at locus/on set $x_3$, otherwise being utterly distinct (and not even on the same axis/scale) in sense $x_4$
column3: This definition approximately parallels that of {panra}. For geometric orthogonality, fill $x_4$ with "geometry". This can be applied to lines, planes, curves, manifolds, vectors (endowed with inner product), etc. $x_1$ and $x_2$ are necessarily orthogonal at only $x_3$ (but may be elsewhere, such as if they are hyperplanes). $x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetric terbri in this word under permutation. Also: "with negative reciprocal slope local to". This is a local property.

column2: $x_1$ (proposition) is data/information being an example of deep formalization of subject $x_2$ gathered by method $x_3$ (proposition)
$x_1$ is an eyewear used/worn by $x_2$ serving purpose $x_3$.
column3: It is a frame worn in front of the eyes and bears or does not bear transparent/semi-transparent/non-transparent shields for visual correction, eye protection, fashion, or entertainment. The shields are not necessarily lenses. Cf. {le'otci} or {le'orlacni} for a corrective type, which may include {tidlacni} for reading glasses and {xrelacni} for bifocal and trifocal glasses; {badlacni} for a protective type, which may include {srulacni} for goggles and {solylacni} for sunglasses; {jadlacni} for fashion glasses, which may include {rekmeclacni} for rimless glasses and solylacni; {mincimdylacni} for 3D glasses.

column2: $x_1$ is a lantern/flashlight/portable light source illuminating $x_2$, in style/with properties $x_3$
column3: Any small, portable light source designed to be carried; see {lamdu}, {fagri}, {gusni}.  It may be a garden decoration, so it may not even emit light, or light is metaphoric; see {jadni}.

column2: $x_1$ is an organism $x_2$ at its larva stage of development
$x_1$ is the home galaxy (default: Milky Way) of object/group/entity/race/vel sim. $x_2$.
$r_1$ is the rafsi prefix used in stage-3 fu'ivla $v_1$=$f_1$, rafsi based on word $r_2$.
column3: rafsi prefix is a term specific to Lojban and refers to the initial part of a stage-3 fu'ivla which is a rafsi. $x_2$ is the word in which the rafsi is used, $x_3$ is the word from which the rafsi has been derived. See also: {cibyfu'ivla}, {fu'ivla}, {rafsi}.

column2: $f_1$=$z_1$=$p_1$ holds the copyright for copying $f_2$=$p_2$ under law $p_3$.
column3: Copyright itself might be "si'o fukzifypo'e". If you are actually translating something with a copyright notice, you should leave the notice in the original language.

column2: $t_1$=$f_1$ is a raft of material $t_2$ shape $t_3$ floating on $f_2$.
$j_1$ decides/makes a decision $j_2$ (du'u) about $j_3$, whose outcome is determined by luck.
$x_1$ is compost.
$sa_1$ is fish sauce for use with $sa_2$, containing ingredients including $sa_3$.
$x_1$=$g1$=$j1$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains stainless steel
$f_1$=$p_1$ is fermented bean paste of soybeans $s_1$=$p_2$.
column3: Fermented bean paste is a category of fermented foods typically made from ground soybeans, which are indigenous to the cuisines of East and Southeast Asia, such as miso.

column2: $x_1$ rusts
$t_1$=$f_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of rust.
$x_1$ is old enough to have responsibility $x_2$, according to standard $x_3$
$t_1$=$f1$ is a director/trustee on the board of directors/trustees of $f_2$.
$k_1$=$t_1$=$f_1$ is the board of directors/trustees of  $k_3$.
column5: board;board of directors;Board of Directors;board of trustees

column2: $x_1$ holds $x_2$ responsible for $x_3$ (event/action)
$b_1$ is a broom with bristles $b_2$ with long handle $g_1$.
$j_1$ plays baseball against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$co_1$ is a mop/swab/swob for soaking up $ci_1$=$co_2$ with long handle $g_1$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) pole dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$ using pole $g_1$.
$x_1$ is a truss for supporting $x_2$
$x_1$ is truss bridge a over/across $x_2$ between $x_3$ and $x_4$
$x_1$ is a popsicle with ice cream $x_2$=$b_1$=$l_1$ and stick $x_3$=$g_1$.
$x_1$ is a french-fried potato of variety/cultivar $x_2$ cooked in fat/oil $x_3$
$v_1$ is a grate between $v_2$ and $v_3$ of material $g_2$=$x_4$.
$b_1$ is a gas cylinder [closable container for gas] made of material $b_3$ with lid $b_4$.
$x_1$=$d_1$=$g_2$ desublimates from the gaseous state at temperature $x_2$=$d_2$=$g_3$ with pressure $x_3$=$d_3$.
column3: The process of this is called deposition or desublimation in English. From {gapci} {dunja}; refers to a direct change of the state of matter from gaseous to solid. Cf. {ligyfebvi}.

column2: $g_1$=$z_1$ perceives $z_2$ to have quality $g_2$ by means/sense $g_3$=$z_3$ under conditions $g_4$=$z_4$
$x_1 = cuxna_3$ (set) is the collection of options/settings that can be chosen by user $x_2 = cuxna_1$ ~ $galfi_1$ for purpose $x_3$.
column3: cuxna2 is deleted; galfi1 was raised from an event abstraction to a person agent; the third sumti slot of this word is not predictable from veljvo (but is inspired by galfi2). x3 is the interface feature which the choices modify; for example, x3 can be the sound amplitude ('loudness') feature/setting on a speaker and x1 is a set of values for that feature (according to some scale) which can be achieved by the speaker output.

column2: $x_1$ (agent) causes $x_2$ (event) to modify/alter/change/transform/convert $x_3$ into $x_4$
column3: This is a {jvajvo}: {galfi} {zei} {gasnu}. Included in the dictionary because it's referenced in the notes for {galfi}.

column2: $x_1$=$z_1$=$g_1$ is a zmico that modifies the terbri default specification of a brivla, producing result $x_2$=$z_2$=$g_3$ at level/with construct-orientation $x_3$=$z_3$ with discourse duration $x_4$=$z_4$ in language $x_5$=$z_5$; $x_1$ is a default specification modifier that produces output re-specification $x_2$
column3: {zmico} is an experimental gismu. See also: {zmico}, {sumyzmico}

column2: $m_1$=$g_1$ is a cover/[lid/top] for sheltering $m_2$=$g_2$ from danger/threat $m_3$.
$j_1$ is the president of people $g_2$ in country $g_3$.
$n_1$ is a summit between $j_1$=$c_1$ (heads of state/government) about topic/subject $c_2$.
column3: x2 are usually presidents or prime ministers. x3 are points on an agenda (= snuselpla). Cf. {casnu}.

column2: $c_1$ is a supranational union of member states $g_1$=$j_1$=$c_3$
$x_1$ is a Google Group for $x_2$ to discuss/talk about subject $x_3$
$x_1$ is a Google Group for $x_2$ to discuss/talk about subject $x_3$
column3: -zam- is the rafsi of {zai'e}, indicating a jargon word, and the divorce of {girzu} from its normal meaning. Place structure based off of {snustu}.

column2: $x_1$ migrates to country $x_2$ from country $x_3$ over path/route $x_4$.
$r_1$ is abroad, located across national border $r_2$, relative to $r_3$ (default: the speaker).
column3: From {gugde} + {ragve}. If /gv/ is ever declared a valid initial consonant sequence, this word will become a {valrtosmabru} (ill-formed word that breaks apart into a {cmavo} and a {lujvo}), and will need to be replaced by {gugdyragve}.

column2: $k_1$ is a diplomat/ambassador representing country $k_2$=$g_1$ in matter(s)/function(s) $k_3$.
$p_1$ is a state/province/region (first-level administrative division) of country $p_2$=$g_1$.
column3: Cf.{gugde}, {pagbu}.  A province or region can also be a second-level administrative division; for these use {gugypausle}.

column2: $s_1$ is a county/district/parish/province (second-level administrative division) of country $s_2$=$g_1$.
column3: Cf. {gugde}, {pagbu}, {selci}. A province can also be a first-level administrative division; for this use {gugypau}, or optionally {vipygu'e} if it is in a country with a federal government.

column2: $s_1$ is quick-as-light at doing $s_2$
$g_1$=$c_1$ is sandy abrasive material.
$x_1$=$c_1$ (agent) massacres/commits genocide against $x_2$=$c_2$=$g_1$(mass of people) by action/method $x_3$=$c_3$
$x_1$ is part/member of aggregate/group/mass $x_2$.
$x_1$(mass) brawls with $x_2$(mass) over issue $x_3$ (abstract)
$ga_1$ combines individual $gu_2$ into mass $gu_1$.
$gun_1$=$gug_1$ is a federative state consisting of states/lands $gun_2$
$d_1$=$g_1$ is a pool of water.
$x_1$ mass produces $x_2$ [product] by process $x_3$
$b_1$=$g_1$ is ready for work/labor $g_2$ with goal $g_3$.
$x_1$ is a rsum / cv / curriculum vita, summarizing $x_2$'s work experience, in medium $x_3$.
$gunm_1$ is a project consisting of tasks $gunk_2$ done by $gunk_1$ with goal/objective $gunk_3$.
$x_1$=$z_1$=$r_1$=$g_1$ procrastinates/avoids doing work $x_2$=$r_2$=$g_2$ (ka), instead doing $x_3$=$r_3$ (ka).
column3: I figured I'd FINALLY get around to defining this, only for it to be in order to delay doing homework. cf. {zukte}, {rivbi}, {gunka}, {dimna}, {funca}.

column2: $s_1$ is a communist ideology (default: Marxist-Leninist) as it applies to the governance of  people/territory/domain $t_2$ based on the works of thinker(s) $s_3$
$x_1$ is Ithkuil (language), used by $x_2$ to communicate $x_3$ (du'u/si'o)
$x_1$=$d_1$=$k_1$ wants to play with plaything $x_2$=$d_2$=$k_2$ for purpose $x_3$=$d_3$.
$k_1$=$g_1$ is a team / play group together playing / playing with plaything / toy / game $k_2$=$g_2$; members are from set $g_3$ linked by relations $g_4$.
keijvi  $x_1$ competes/vies with opponent $x_2$ in game $x_3$
$x_1$ is a moving piece used in a game $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a board used for playing the game $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a toy
$x_1$ is a game played by $x_2$ governed by rules $x_3$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual) $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a toy / plaything / object used for play
$g_1$ is a game master/dungeon master for players $k_1$=$g_2$ in role-playing game $g_3$.
$x_1$ is a playing card
$x_1$ is a turn/move by player $x_2$ in game $x_3$.
$ku_1$ is a die/are dice for game $x_2$ with surfaces/sides $ku_3$ (default 6).
column3: Shortened from ke nu kelci ke'e kubli. Omitted $ku_2$ (dice have always three dimensions). Cf. {cu'arkubli}.

column2: $x_1$ is a point in game $x_2$
$x_1$ lost the game
column3: Saying this causes all listeners to lose the game as well.

column2: $k_1$=$p_1$ feels playful love towards $k_2$=$p_2$.
$p_1$ is a playground managed by community/polity/organization $p_2$.
$x_1$ is a video game / computer game
$x_1$ (set) has the most extreme cardinality, in direction $x_2$ (default: ka zmadu), among $x_3$ (set of sets)
$r_1$ (event/substance) effects/physically causes cancer (of type) $r_2$=$k_1$ under conditions $r_3$.
$x_1$=$s_1$ (mass of facts) is oncology of focus $x_2$=$s_2$ based on methodology $x_3$=$s_3$
$x_1$=$s_1$ is a cancer cell of/causing cancer [malignant disease] $x_2$=$s_2$
$x_1$ is an astronaut/cosmonaut/taikonaut
$x_1$ is an earring
$l_1$ is earwax/cerumen.
$n_1$=$b_1$ is an eardrum (tympanic membrane) of $n_2$=$k_2$.
column3: The tympanic membrane separates the external ear from the middle ear. Cf. {kerlo}, {tirna}, {sance}.

column2: $b_1$=$s_1$ is a temporal bone (os temporale) performing function $b_2$ in body of $b_3$.
$x_1$ is an earphone/headphone
$k_1$=$z_1$ is an earlobe of $k_2$=$z_2$.
$x_1$=$f_1$ is extraterrestrial/alien, from/associated with celestial body/region $x_2$=$k_2$
column3: From {kensa} {fange}. kesfange {dacti}: extraterrestrial object, kesfange {jmive}: extraterrestial life, kesfange {prenu}: extraterrestial person/sapient being

column2: $x_1$ is a space program
$x_1$ is an astronaut/cosmonaut, associated with astronomical body $x_2$.
column3: No reference to country/culture of origin.

column2: $x_1$ is a spaceship/starship/(outer)space vessel for carrying $x_2$ and propelled by $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a celestial body/object with associated space/region $x_2$.
column3: Probably equivalent to "{selkensa}" except restricted to physically material objects. See also: "{astro}".

column2: $x_1$ is a nebula of material $x_2$
$saske_1$ is astrology (mass of facts) of subject matter $saske_2$ based on methodology $saske_3$=$jetnu_1$ of celestial bodies
$p_1$ is a space suit of material $p_2$.
$x_1$ is astronomy based on methodology $x_2$.
$x_1$ is an astronomer.
$x_1$ is a spaceplane carrying payload $x_2$ propelled by $x_3$.
$x_1$ repeats  $x_2$ (sedu'u/text) to audience $x_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$ for the $x_5$th time.
$x_1$ is a reprise / repeated musical passage produced by $x_2$ (event)

column2: $x_1$ is to $x_2$ as $x_3$ is to $x_4$ as $x_5$ is to $x_6$ ...
